title: Autonomous Uncertainty Quantification for Computational Point-of-care Sensors
summary: This paper introduces an autonomous uncertainty quantification (UQ) technique, leveraging Monte Carlo dropout (MCDO), to enhance the reliability of neural network-based computational point-of-care (POC) diagnostic sensors. Applied to a paper-based xVFA platform for rapid Lyme disease diagnosis, this method significantly improved diagnostic sensitivity from 88.2% to 95.7% by identifying and excluding erroneous, high-uncertainty predictions without requiring ground truth data during operation.

title: TICON: A Slide-Level Tile Contextualizer for Histopathology Representation Learning
summary: TICON introduces a novel transformer-based tile contextualizer that generates rich, slide-level contextualized embeddings for histopathology images, addressing the limitations of context-stripped tile encoders. By unifying and enhancing representations from diverse tile-level foundation models via a masked modeling objective, TICON achieves new state-of-the-art performance across various computational pathology benchmarks and enables the training of a superior slide-level foundation model with significantly less data.

title: An Allele-Centric Pan-Graph-Matrix Representation for Scalable Pangenome Analysis
summary: This paper introduces the H1 pan-graph-matrix, an allele-centric representation for pangenome analysis designed to overcome limitations of existing sequence-, path-, or sample-centric formats. H1 employs adaptive per-allele compression to encode exact haplotype membership, achieving near-optimal storage across all variant types, particularly for structural variations. A path-centric dual, H2, is also presented, maintaining full information equivalence while enabling explicit haplotype ordering for downstream applications.

title: Deep Learning Classification of EEG Responses to Multi-Dimensional Transcranial Electrical Stimulation
summary: This study introduces a novel framework utilizing Deep Learning to objectively classify EEG brain responses evoked by multi-dimensional transcranial electrical stimulation (TES) for assessing conscious level. They demonstrated that transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) targeting the angular gyrus elicited exceptionally reliable EEG responses, enabling a Convolutional Neural Network to achieve a 92% F1-score on unseen data, significantly outperforming human-level performance. These findings establish a robust method for consciousness measurement applicable in clinical settings.

title: Patterns vs. Patients: Evaluating LLMs against Mental Health Professionals on Personality Disorder Diagnosis through First-Person Narratives
summary: This study directly compared state-of-the-art Large Language Models (LLMs), specifically Gemini Pro, against mental health professionals in diagnosing Borderline (BPD) and Narcissistic (NPD) Personality Disorders using Polish first-person narratives. While LLMs demonstrated higher overall diagnostic accuracy and proficiency in identifying BPD, they severely underdiagnosed NPD, highlighting significant reliability and bias issues despite their competence in interpreting complex qualitative clinical data.

title: UbiQVision: Quantifying Uncertainty in XAI for Image Recognition
summary: This paper introduces UbiQVision, a novel framework designed to quantify uncertainty in SHAP-based eXplainable AI (XAI) visualizations, particularly in medical imaging applications. It addresses the instability and unreliability of SHAP explanations, which stem from epistemic and aleatoric uncertainty in complex deep learning models, by leveraging Dirichlet posterior sampling and Dempster-Shafer theory. The framework provides uncertainty quantification through belief, plausible, and fusion maps, validated across diverse medical imaging datasets from pathology, ophthalmology, and radiology.

title: Drug-like antibodies with low immunogenicity in human panels designed with Latent-X2
summary: Latent-X2 is a novel generative AI model that achieves zero-shot design of drug-like molecules, particularly antibodies, with strong binding affinities and exceptional developability profiles. Uniquely, it is the first AI to design antibodies confirmed to have low immunogenicity in human donor panels, demonstrating therapeutic viability without extensive optimization.

title: Effect of Activation Function and Model Optimizer on the Performance of Human Activity Recognition System Using Various Deep Learning Models
summary: This study comprehensively investigates the combined impact of activation functions (AFs) and model optimizers (MOs) on Human Activity Recognition (HAR) system performance using BiLSTM and ConvLSTM deep learning models. The research reveals that ConvLSTM consistently outperforms BiLSTM, with ConvLSTM achieving up to 99.00% accuracy when paired with Adam or RMSprop on medically relevant activities, providing crucial insights for optimizing healthcare-oriented HAR systems.

title: Reason2Decide: Rationale-Driven Multi-Task Learning
summary: Reason2Decide is a novel two-stage training framework designed for clinical decision support systems to simultaneously achieve high predictive accuracy and generate explanations aligned with those predictions. By addressing exposure bias through scheduled sampling and efficient multi-task learning, it outperforms existing fine-tuning baselines and some zero-shot LLMs. Importantly, it achieves these gains with models 40x smaller, making explainable clinical reasoning more accessible for resource-constrained deployments.

title: Fabrication, drug delivery kinetics and cell viability assay of PLGA-coated vancomycin-loaded silicate porous microspheres
summary: This paper introduces PLGA-coated porous Mg-Ca silicate microspheres (diopside, bredigite, akermanite) loaded with vancomycin, designed for controlled drug release and bone tissue applications. It demonstrates that PLGA coating significantly reduces drug burst release, improves cytocompatibility, and dominates drug diffusion kinetics, with akermanite-based microspheres showing the most promising biocompatibility.

title: MAPI-GNN: Multi-Activation Plane Interaction Graph Neural Network for Multimodal Medical Diagnosis
summary: Graph neural networks are increasingly applied to multimodal medical diagnosis for their inherent relational modeling capabilities.
